content.text: Set up the circuit shown in Fig. 1.1 using \(R_{1} = 33 \Omega\) and \(R_{2} = 82 \Omega\)
Use six different pairs of resistors to provide six different values of \(\frac{R_1R_2}{(R_1 + R_2)}\)
For each arrangement, record \(R_{1}, R_{2}\) and \(I\) in a table. Include values of \(\frac{R_{1}R_{2}}{(R_{1} + R_{2})}\) and \(\frac{1}{I}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{1}{I}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{R_1R_2}{(R_1 + R_2)}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
It is suggested that the quantities \(I\) and \(\frac{R_1R_2}{(R_1 + R_2)}\) are related by the equation
Using your answers to (c)(iii), determine the values of \(P\) and \(Q\)
The constants \(P\) and \(Q\) are related to the electromotive force (e.m.f.) \(E\) of the power supply and the resistance \(Z\) of resistor \(Z\) by
In this experiment, you will investigate combinations of resistors in an electrical circuit
You have been provided with filter papers of two different sizes
Take one sheet of the **smaller** filter paper
The diameter of one sheet of filter paper is \(d\), as shown in Fig. 2.1
Calculate the area \(A\) of the filter paper using
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your value of \(A\)
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 2.2
Hold the six sheets of the smaller filter paper at the top of the metre rule, as shown in Fig. 2.2
Release the filter papers and start the stop-watch
The time between release and the filter papers hitting the bench is \(t\)
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in \(t\). Show your working
Measure and record the total mass \(m\) of the sheets of smaller filter paper
Repeat (a)(i) and (a)(ii) using one of the larger sheets of filter paper
Using two sheets of the larger filter paper, repeat (b)(i) and (b)(iii)
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\)
Explain whether your results support the suggested relationship
It is suggested that the relationship between \(t, m\) and \(A\) is
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
Describe four improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**
In this experiment, you will investigate the time taken for filter papers to fall in air
